alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 17 at 9:23PM CST until December 17 at 9:45PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CST FOR SOUTHEASTERN ST. LOUIS AND CENTRAL DOUGLAS COUNTIES... At 922 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Hawthorne, to near City of Rice Lake, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This snow squall is currently impacting the I-35, US-53, and US-2 corridors through the Twin Ports. Locations impacted include... Duluth, Superior, Hermantown, Hawthorne, Lake Nebagamon, Maple, Brule, Poplar, Solon Springs, Gordon, South Range, McQuade Harbor, Wisconsin Point, City of Rice Lake, Amnicon Falls State Park, Pike Lake Near Duluth, Irving, Bennett, Cloverland, and Cody. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
